Description: Fragment of oval handle from neck join to sharpish turn of a Rhodian pottery transport amphora. Clay fine light brown; cream slip. Rectangular stamp.
Production date: 143 BC (see N. Badoud, Le temps de Rhodes, 2015, 143.)
Curator's comments: Ink, deleted, '108̣'. Name Anaxandros. From the same die as Alexandria, Greco-Roman Museum, ABC 0047.30.
Bibliographic references: Stoddart 1847 / Memoir on the inscribed pottery of Rhodes, Cnidus and other Greek Cities (18)
